wikipedia_page.main: Robert Carey (1821–1883) was a Major-General in the British Army, and served as Colonel in the New Zealand Wars.

response: In early March, Cameron went to Auckland to consult with Grey and the government for the next steps in the campaign and it was decided to continue with the strategy of depriving the Kingites of supplies. To this end, Cameron, moved most of his army towards Maungatautari leaving a garrison for redoubts being built at Kihikihi, Rangiaowhia, and Te Awamutu, where a strike force of 900 men under Colonel Robert Carey was also based. In the meantime, Maniapoto started construction of a pā at Ōrākau, which was  from Kihikihi.
* Robert Carey (1821–1883), Major-General in the British Army

response: * Robert Carey - Commander of British forces at the Battle of Ōrākau
*Robert Carey (British Army officer) (1821–1883), British Army major general

link_mentions.page: List of people with surname Carey
response: * Robert Carey, 1st Earl of Monmouth (c. 1560–1639), from the West Country family, son of 1st Baron Hunsdon,
* Robert Carey (British Army officer) (1821–1883), from the Guernsey, Channel Islands family
* Robert Carey (died 1587) (c. 1515–1587), English Member of Parliament
* Thomas Carey (English politician) (died 1634), English Member of Parliament, son of Robert Carey, 1st Earl of Monmouth
